head.title: 60% OF AIR INDIA TO BE SOLD

hedline.hl1: 60% OF AIR INDIA TO BE SOLD

abstract.p: Indian cabinet committee decides to privatize money-losing Air India by selling 60 percent stake to strategic partners, private investors and employees; will let foreign airline hold up to 26 percent stake (S)

block.p: India's cabinet committee on disinvestment decided to privatize India's money-losing international flag carrier Air India by selling a 60 percent stake. The government will retain a 40 percent stake and sell the remainder to strategic partners, private investors and employees. The government will allow a foreign airline to hold up to a maximum 26 percent stake in the airline. To reduce its losses, Air India has drawn up early-retirement plans for 60 percent of its employees. Air India currently has 26 airplanes in its fleet, including 11 Airbus jets and 15 Boeing aircraft. It flies to 11 cities within India and 23 cities abroad.
